div.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, June 1, 1917. LANGUAGES AND PEOPLE

body.p: When Joffre and Viviana, the eminent French guests, visit President Wilson, they will have to resort to enterpreters. Joffre cannot understand English, nor President Wilson French.
Billy Sunday was introduced to Marshall Joffre. Afterwards a reporter asked him what the French general had said, "Oh, he chattered about something in his language," replied Billy Sunday.
The moral of this is: it is a poor policy not to learn a foreign language.

After the war the United States will come in closer relationship with South America, where Spanish is spoken, and also in closer relationship with Europe. May our young people remember this and start studying Spanish and French.
